text: Yekaterina Akakievna Mtsituridze (, ; born January 10, 1972, Tbilisi, Georgian SSRБиография на сайте Первого канала) is a Russian television presenter, film critic and film expert of Georgian origin. Former editor-in-chief of Variety Russia, head of Roskino (since 2011),Глава «Роскино» заявила о провале почти всех новых российских фильмов the Channel One Russia movie expert, author of the concept and general producer of St. Petersburg International Media Forum. Member of the Union of Cinematographers of the Russian Federation, a member of the Union of Journalists of Russia and the International Union of Journalists, a member of the Association of the International Film Press FIPRESCI, an academician of the National Academy of Cinematographic Arts and Sciences of Russia, Master of Historical Sciences.Екатерина Мцитуридзе. Сюжеты ==Biography== She was born on January 10, 1972 in Tbilisi (Georgian SSR, USSR). In she graduated from the History and Cinema Science Department of the Tbilisi State University. Since 1994 he lives in Moscow.Екатерина Мцитуридзе // Vedomosti Member of the jury of contest Un Certain Regard in 2008 Cannes Film Festival, 1st and 2nd Moscow Jewish Film FestivalsВ Москве пройдёт еврейский кинофестиваль In October 2017 Mtsituridze told the press in detail that she twice, in 2003 at the Berlin Film Festival and in 2004 at the Venice Film Festival, was sexually harassed by Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein. ==References== ==External links== * * Обзор стиля Екатерины Мцитуридзе // spletnik.ru * Российскому кино нужны системные реформы // 2017 Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Film people from Tbilisi Category:Tbilisi State University alumni Category:Russian television presenters Category:Russian film critics Category:Russian film producers Category:Georgian emigrants to Russia Category:Georgian people of Russian descent
title: Yekaterina Mtsituridze
